official-title.#text:
To require analyses of the cumulative and incremental
		  impacts of certain rules and actions of the Environmental Protection Agency,
		  and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail:
, and in
			 addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the

) introduced the

short-title.#text:
Transparency in Regulatory Analysis of
			 Impacts on the Nation Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Committee for the

			 United States

(in this Act referred to

) to analyze and report on the cumulative and
			 incremental impacts of certain rules and actions of the

			 consider pertinent reports issued by, the Electric Reliability Organization
			 certified under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee for the Cumulative Analysis of Regulations that Impact Energy and Manufacturing in the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 215(c) of the Federal Power Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Power Act/s:215/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall terminate 60 days after
			 submitting its final report pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee for the Cumulative Analysis of Regulations that Impact Energy and Manufacturing in the United States
Transparency in Regulatory Analysis of Impacts on the Nation Act of 2013/s:4/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct analyses, for each of the calendar years 2018, 2023,
			 and 2030, of the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee for the Cumulative Analysis of Regulations that Impact Energy and Manufacturing in the United States

text.#text:
The cumulative impact of covered rules that
			 are promulgated as final regulations on or before January 1, 2014, in
			 combination with covered actions.

The cumulative impact of all covered rules
			 (including covered rules that have not been promulgated as final regulations on
			 or before January 1, 2014), in combination with covered actions.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparency in Regulatory Analysis of Impacts on the Nation Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
The incremental impact of each covered rule
			 not promulgated as a final regulation on or before January 1, 2014, relative to
			 an analytic baseline representing the results of the analysis conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall include in each
			 analysis conducted under this section the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee for the Cumulative Analysis of Regulations that Impact Energy and Manufacturing in the United States

text.#text:
Estimates of the
			 impacts of the covered rules and covered actions with regard to—

any resulting
			 change in national, State, and regional electricity prices;

any resulting change in national, State,
			 and regional fuel prices;

the impact on national, State, and regional
			 employment during the 5-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this
			 Act, and also in the long term, including secondary impacts associated with
			 increased energy prices and facility closures; and

the reliability
			 and adequacy of bulk power supply in the United States.

Discussion of key uncertainties and
			 assumptions associated with each estimate.

continuation-text.#text:
as well as
			 key uncertainties associated with each topic.

text.#text:
Discussion, and where feasible an
			 assessment, of the cumulative impact of the covered rules and covered actions
			 on—

local and
			 industry-specific labor markets; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall use the best available methods, consistent with guidance
			 from the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs and the Office of
			 Management and Budget Circular A–4.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee for the Cumulative Analysis of Regulations that Impact Energy and Manufacturing in the United States

text.#text:
In conducting analyses under this section,
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee for the Cumulative Analysis of Regulations that Impact Energy and Manufacturing in the United States

text.#text:
In conducting analyses under this section,
			 the

shall use the best
			 data that is available to the public or supplied to the Committee by its
			 members, including the most recent such data appropriate for this analysis
			 representing air quality, facility emissions, and installed controls;
			 and

is not required to
			 create data or to use data that is not readily accessible.

The following
			 published rules (including any successor or substantially similar rule):

National Ambient Air Quality
			 Standards for Ozone

			 Institutional Boilers

Hazardous and Solid Waste Management

National

Effluent Limitations Guidelines and
			 Standards for the Construction and Development Point Source Category
